name: Marival Resort & Suites

reviews.title: Worst Trip Ever
reviews.text: This is the most honest review I can offer. Before I tell you what was wrong with our trip to the Marival, I need to frame the backdrop. We are owners with the Royal Resorts (5 Star) in Cancun and I worked in the resorts portion of Walt Disney World while in college. We're used to organized, clean, polite, first class everything. We didn't find these characteristics connected to any part of our Marival visit.

reviews.title: The Best!!!!
reviews.text: We wanted to take a 4 day trip to another part of Mexico (not Cancun). Our travel agent looked through her books and came up with the Marival for our new experience. It was an experience I wish we'd never had.

All I can say is that I'm really glad we didn't take our kids on this trip. It would have been difficult to keep them away from trash around the pool and the worst food I've ever encountered in any kind of hotel or resort.
reviews.title: Prepare to relax at the Marival Grand

likes.disliked: — The beds and pillows were a bit hard for my taste.

reviews.text: We disliked this property so much that we booked off-site trips and took very expensive cab rides into town just to find ways to make our trip enjoyable.
reviews.title: Beautiful Marival
Great Vacation
reviews.text: One of our enjoyable trips was a horseback trip to a large waterfall in the jungle. Another trip was an evening boat cruise to a very cool native dance show and dinner. These trips had no connection to the Marival. Also, we ran into someone on the plane who lives part time in Puerto Vallarta. He sent us to one of the best meals we've ever had on the far South side of the city. I wish I could remember the name of the place but it was on the beach and was just about the last building on the South end of the city before you run into jungle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is a little above an average resort but not an above average one I couldn’t give it an above rating. We have stayed at other all inclusive before so my review is based on above average experience. I will attempt to provide you why I have stated this:
reviews.title: June 12 - June 19

likes.disliked: — Humid at the time we traveled

reviews.text: Resort – The resort is not a very large the grounds and hotel are well kept. Their beach is small and the waves are very good for bogie boarding. Activities are planned well with having 3 pools one for kids, activity’s such a pool basketball (swim up bar) and the adult pool (swim up bar) much quieter makes for every one with a pool to enjoy. The bars are great with brand liquor and good service. Overall the staff is not what I would call the friendliest, however they are pleasant.
reviews.title: Good Food and good holiday at the Marival

reviews.text: Rooms – Very simple with firm beds but comfortable, tile floors, bath rooms are clean and supplied with all the towels you need or request, TV has NY stations with International CNN. The one thing we had to deal with was they very humid, which made the a little musty. We always take a candle so that was no big deal. No bugs was every seen and the view we had in a basic room was great (1600 bld) had a view of ocean from balcony.
reviews.title: Overall Pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food – Food would be considered average not great. The breakfast buffet had the same thing each day and seems to run short around 9:00 am. We ate most breakfast most of the time in La Pergola.
reviews.title: AWESOME HONEYMOON AT THE MARIVAL

reviews.text: La Pergola – At night it’s Mediterranean and the food is good, ate there several nights
reviews.title: Watch your nickels and dimes…

likes.disliked: — Nickel and Dimed on small stuff

reviews.text: I use Trip Advisor a lot; we love to hear what others have to say about destinations we choose for our family vacations. Some have been on the money, others have been a little off but overall, they have helped us to see what we have to look out for or forward to.
reviews.title: Too much timeshare talk and too many unsupervised kids

likes.liked: — Not a 4 star but the bed was comfortable and the landscaping was beautiful. drinks were good too, especially the martini bar.

reviews.text: We just returned from our trip tonight and I wanted to write this now, before I forgot anything . . . . This is a long one but I don't want to leave anything out, so if you don't want to hear about our week long stay, move on to the next review.
reviews.title: A lot of improvements needed.

likes.disliked: — Hot and Humiid. Poor quality foods

reviews.title: Marival Grand June 14-21, 2008
reviews.text: From the time we got off the plane, we were bombarded with timeshare pleas and pushes. I had remembered this from our last stay in Mexico and politely said "no thank you" but of course that wasn't enough. I had to be a little rude and actually walk away from the person in mid sentence. Once we found our transportation to the resort, it started to get a little better, but wouldn't you know it, upon checking in we discovered that the ocean view 1 bedroom suite we requested was not available and after checking to see if there were any 2 bedrooms available we were given building #9 (with a view of the put-put golf course and children’s club). I was alright with that after such a long flight, all I wanted to do was get my suit on and get to the pool, but then we were assigned a person that was going to tell us a little bout the resort and how to get around, make dinner reservations, where to find the desk for excursions, etc., we were again bombarded with the talk for time shares and how we could have a free something if we gave them 90 mins of our vacations time. I politely agreed thinking we could do the jungle tour for free and still do a few more later in the week, at our own expense. We sat for the timeshare talk and before anything was said I told the guy that I had sat thru one before but didn't appreciate being pushed or pressured, he agreed and said this was not going to go like that . . . He lied! We were almost done until his boss decided to join and almost go over the whole thing again, when I told him this all sounded good but that we weren't interested but would think about it for sometime in the future (as my husband and I have talked about getting a place) he wouldn't talk no for an answer. I finally had to get up and walk out, leaving my husband to explain my dislike for being pressured into spending our money and time. Our 19 and 6 year old kids were waiting in the room to begin their vacation, and their parents were spending it having their arms twisted. After that unpleasant 2 hour battle, we finally began our vacation. Back at our room, I found that sitting on our balcony wasn’t going to be the pleasant experience I envisioned, as there was a nest of birds who took offense to me sitting there and chose to dive bomb us until we went inside. After calling the front desk to complain, they sent someone to take care of it. I felt a little bad, because they had to knock it down – but hey, I paid good money to have a balcony I could use so I got over my guilt. Of course the birds wouldn’t let me forgot because for the next two days, they acted like the nest was still there and terrorized us by making fly bys at us. They finally got tired and left us alone.

THE POOLS - the activity pool left a lot to be desired, it needs to be re-tiled and some rule needs to be set about kids hanging at the pool bar - no room for adults to sit, drink and hang out, with all the small kids gathering around and making a mess of the drinks that ordered but didn't drink! Getting a lounge chair was pretty easy, just get up early - around 0830 -0900 and place your towels in the chairs. I would recommend that you bring our own, as if someone takes one of the hotel pool towel, you don't get your pool card back and are charged $25.00 for losing it, which leaves you to think about taking someone else’s and that creates a domino effect (as that happened to my brother in law, whose towel was taken). The other pool was nicer, although there are no activities being done there, it is not as crowed and there are better choices of loungers. There is only drink service at "quiet pool" (the adults only) which is fine, if you don't mind standing in line with many adults and some kids, who don't seem to get the concept of waiting your turn.
reviews.title: Definitely Not Worth Staying At

likes.liked: — The rooms were great and very comfortable

reviews.text: THE FOOD - the Bella Vista was the best of all the restaurants, the food is excellent and the atmosphere is wonderful. The M&M bar is there too, and you can get the best martinis and very nice tables for adults to sit and enjoy. I wouldn't recommend the Mediterranean one, as the menu is less to be desired, nothing on the menu was that appetizing and the wait; once you put your order in, took forever. The CasaBella, which is the buffet restaurant and the most popular only because you need no reservation. The food was alright, but the daily menu needs to be rethought. It seemed to have the same thing everyday, even though each night was a different theme. I do know that we weren't in the states and the food is different but at least make it tasty and appealing. The desserts were awful; the cakes were soggy and not very flavorful. It is hotter inside then it was outside, which didn’t help you enjoy the meal and if you ate outside, the flies ruined the meal for you.
reviews.title: Just Average

likes.disliked: — The front desk staff, and the mosquitos at the beach

reviews.text: Marival was a decent place to stay. The food wasn't that great. It was kind of like chuck-o-rama, mexican style. I was there with my mexican side of the family, so that may have affected how we were treated. Anyway, I thought the people there were friendly and were very hard workers. Our room was cleaned/fridge filled up with water/drinks every day (even though other reviews said it was like every 3/4 days). The italian resturaunt "la pergola" wasn't very good. Casa Bella had some decent things to eat - the yogurt and the banana milk/fresh squeezed fruit drinks/tostadas. It was kind of nice to have people bringing you pina coladas even when you're on the beach. I'd avoid the pools since they have swim up bars where a bunch of people just hang out and drink all day - they're too lazy to find a bathroom and I'm sure that's why my skin always itched when I went in the pool. The beach is nice and the vendors aren't too pushy. This place is good if you're not very picky and not set on quality food/posh accomodations - for the price I'm sure you could find something better.
reviews.title: The marival was OK

reviews.text: The pelicans on the beach were really neat - nice calm water for the ninos tambien.
reviews.title: Family Trip to Marival

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews, my husband and I were a bit nervous taking our 6 and 11 year old girls there. However, we found the hotel to be a terrific and SAFE place to be. We stayed from July 5th to July 12th. My review will reflect what we experienced during this time.
reviews.title: Overall Nice Resort

reviews.text: ROOMS: We stayed in a 1 bedroom Ocean Front suite on the Club side. This was an incredible room. The patio let us walk out to one of the pools, so we never had a problem with finding a place to sit. This upgrade was completely worth the money we spent. We woke up to hearing the waves most of the mornings. On two days, we woke up to the most incredible thunder you can imagine. Our girls snuggled up with us in bed and we listened to the thunder. It was an amazing expereince.
reviews.title: Great Experience

likes.disliked: — Timeshare vendors by the check-in desk

reviews.text: TIMESHARE: We knew what we were getting ourselves into with this when we signed up for the presentation. We got a 200.00 voucher to use towards our activities and 5 15% discount coupons to use in the hotel (SPA included. FYI: Spa prices are different from website). We bartered what they originally offered us and got what we wanted. Just
reviews.title: Great - except the beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say, wonderful, My Husband and I stayed at the Marival from 5th June 2007 to 19th June 2007 on our 2nd honeymoon as we were celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary we have absolutely no complaints - the staff were always happy, couldnt do enough for us. We stayed in room 1734 on the Grand side of the hotel, ok the bed was harder than our bed at home but still very comfortable. We had a celebration cake and champagne left in the room for us on arrival. We flew direct from Manchester England so we were very tired when we arrived, check in was simple, we were given a cold drink and a quick guide to the hotel, offered time share but as soon as they learnt we were from England they stopped. There was a fridge in our room which was stocked with beer, pop and water and kept topped up daily. The beach was only 1 minute away from our room and we had regular visits in the bay from the dolphins that live there a big plus as I love dolphins, (we went to Valarta Adventures and swam with them) beach vendors were no problem - if you said no they just leave you alone - no hastle.
reviews.title: 2nd Honeymoon

reviews.text: We met a lot of Americans and Canadians, who kept telling us they loved our accent. We will most definately go back. Highly recommended, don't see how anyone could complain about the hotel.
reviews.title: Ray's Excellent Family Adventure

reviews.text: Review of Marival Resort, Family of 9
reviews.title: Nice Family Resort

reviews.text: The Good
reviews.title: The Honest, Honest Truth- Not that bad...

reviews.text: •Everyone on the staff was very pleasant and helpful regardless of how much you tip. From the Cleaning people, Waiters and Waitresses, Security Guards, Maid Service Staff to even the Beach Vendors were very friendly. If you tip well, you get a little extra attention.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our Marival trip, June 20-24th. We agree that this resort is just a little above an average resort, based on several all-inclusive trips that we've done, we certainly would not give the Marival a 4 1/2 star quality rating--more like a 3 to 3 1/2.
reviews.title: Marival Trip

reviews.text: The Resort – The resort grounds are well kept and beautiful. The hotel isn't as clean and needed some maintenance. We enjoyed the well kept beach area--it was beautiful--with wide open spaces great for morning runs or walks. Activities are well planned with great activity’s such a pool basketball and soccer. There is an adult area separated from the kid area which we appreciated. The bars are great with a good selection of liquor and good service--with the exception of lobby bar (rude service). Our favorite bar was the M & M bar--wonderful martinis!!
reviews.title: Terrible service!!!!!!! Would not go back..

reviews.text: Staff - One reason I would not return to the Marival would be the staff. Our overall rating of staff/customer interaction is poor. The staff is not the friendliest. They could be pleasant, but not helpful or friendly. We've stayed at many inclusive resorts and had not experienced rude service--this greatly surprised us.
reviews.title: Great family vacation at the Marival
Great Fun at the Marival!
reviews.text: Rooms – The rooms are very simple with firm beds, but comfortable. Our favorite part of our mornings was to sit on our balcony with our coffee. We would enjoy a great view of the ocean and the morning hustle and bustle of the hotel workers. No bugs were ever seen.

Food – Food would be considered average not great. There was a wide selection available. We only ate at two specialty restaurants, Las Palomas, and Bellavista. We made our reservations one week ahead of our arrival via their website. We ate at the buffet (Casabella) for breakfast once, and for dinner twice. The buffet has theme nights, with a different specialty every night. Food at the buffet was average. We did eat breakfast at the La Pergola, here you order off a menu. Good breakfast here. The two snack bars offer chips, guacamole, salsa, pizza, hamburgers, fajitas, etc. Both snack bars were good.
reviews.title: Wonderful but...

likes.disliked: — Brown foam on beach, too many children

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marival (6/28/08 to 7/7/08) with our adult children (20-27), and their boyfriend, girlfriend and friend.
reviews.title: Our July Stay

likes.liked: — Very clean, Great beach, Nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in
reviews.title: Crowded, dated and subpar

reviews.text: Check in went very smooth, which says a lot when you are checking in with 10 people. We had 5 rooms and 4 were on the Club side and one was on the Grand. We asked to have them moved closer to everyone but nothing was available. They could move them the next day to the Club but still not the same building. I know the travel agent noted all of us as staying together so I don't know what happened.
reviews.title: Anybody want a timeshare?

likes.liked: — The grounds and facilities were beautiful and well maintained

reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: We loved Marival for the price we paid

reviews.text: Rooms were all very nice. Contrary to a previous poster, we did have some sort of topping on the bed when we arrived and it was very comfortable. However, the beds were short. We had 5 men all 6 foot and over all all said their feet hung over. However, everyone’s AC worked fine and it got very cold. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning everyday. The rooms on the Club side-we had 4-were in the main building. It was very convenient to everything. It could be pretty noisy at night as after the show as there was further entertainment in the lobby and the bar was open til midnight. We were only in the room one night before midnight so not a problem for us.
reviews.title: Food Poisoning - but a great first week!

reviews.text: Marival has beautiful grounds! The beach is great and we stayed in bldng 2, and had an amazing 1 bdrm suite. However, the resort staff is basic, the food is sad and overall this resort has nothing to offer that stands out. The bartenders and servers are just cranky. Even some of the activity staff were just rude...The vendors on the beach were much nicer...And the other reviews are correct...only one type of beer is offered. Such a bummer when there are so many great mexican beers out there. There was a group of 12 of us, and we all had a good time, but the resort did not provide anything special.
reviews.title: Very basic vacation w/ very basic service

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marival for a week with 3 teens, ages 12, 12 and 14 and had a great time! The room was a one bedroom suite with 2 full bathrooms, on the club side. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The entire property was very clean and the staff was always working to make everything look nice. The pools were great and the activity staff had lots of fun things to do throughout the day. The view was breathtaking and we watched the sun set every evening on the beach. Our kids had a great time boogie boarding in the rougher afternoon waves. The food at the buffet Casa Bella was just okay, so we didn't eat there often. The 3 restaurants that required dinner reservations were excellent, and very accommodating to our sometimes picky eaters. All the dinners we had were very good with excellent service, Bella Vista was our favorite. For lunches we usually ate at the snack bar areas and didn't have any complaints. LaPergola was also available for breakfast and lunch without reservations and had better food than the buffet or snack bars. The drinks were great and served with a smile at the restaurants or pool bars. All in all, we had a great family vacation and would stay at the Marival again. I was a bit worried about all the negative reviews I had read, but remember this is Mexico and things will not be like they are at home, isn't this the reason we go on vacation! Our only complaint would be about the lady who was in charge of making dinner reservations, she was not friendly and down right rude.
reviews.title: Great for families with teens

likes.disliked: — The person in charge of making dinner reservations

reviews.text: The setting for the Marival transports you into another realm, just as vacations, ideally, are supposed to do. As mentioned by another commentator, the pictures do not really capture the beauty of the setting. Then there's the sensual on top of the visual--the power of the waves, even though there was only one day when they were really powerful, even when they weren't it was enough. There's the lounging after the exercise, then more exercise, and more lounging. Stretch out under the waterfall in the main pool--the pounding of the water on your back is a massage. What can you say about the ocean at night--the sound of the surf in the darkness, wading in just barely--there's something primeval about it. There's the large, dinosaur-looking birds, very exotic. And there's the escape, in my case with extended family, that allows you all to reconnect.
reviews.title: Paradise Minus (I think)

likes.liked: — The beauty of the setting, the waves in the ocean, the freshly ground coffee in the buffet
likes.disliked: — Much too big, too impersonal, staff doesn't care if you have a problem--no teen club despite advertisement

reviews.text: But the Marival is too big and too impersonal for my taste. Of course you know you're in Mexico, but somehow it's just a tad too glitzy or something, so that you feel like you could be in a resort anywhere. Because of the size, the animacion team, such as they are, are barely a presence. On the other hand, there's lots of different spaces to hang out in (many of them air conditioned, including the buffet and the theater).
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel but Very Noisy

reviews.text: We also found it to be true, as mentioned by others here, that the staff is not terribly accommodating if you have any sort of problem. Right above our rooms the hotel was doing construction, with loud banging starting at 10:00 a.m. The first morning I complained, and while the front desk person acted like it was insane to be still sleeping at that hour, he called somebody and assured me no construction the next day until 11:00. The next day it started again promptly at 10:00. I had to complain to many people, finally the hotel manager, before they agreed to defer starting time. The front desk people glared at me the rest of the week (maybe especially because I was thereafter up before 10:00).
reviews.title: red flag warning

description: Book Something Different and enjoy Something Better! Enjoy our beachfront Sun ‘n Fun Resort with nonstop activities and a wide range of dining choices- 6 restaurants, 4 specialty, 7 bars including 2 swim-ups & Martini bar. Book a Resort room, or even one to three bedroom Suites featuring living rooms and independent dining areas, balconies, terraces and oceanfront locations to spread out and enjoy a villa style vacation. Something for every taste, every age!Special Room Sizes and Locations Provide a Variety of AccommodationsDeluxe Resort Rooms. One Bedroom Suites, including Oceanfront up to 760 sq ft. Two and Three Bedroom Villa Suites, Oceanfront up to 1260 sq ft.
